subject: Re: [junit] Re: About JunitReport
msgSnippet: Hi Jan, ... I see. That makes sense, although parsing the relevant stuff from a big chunk of output might be somewhat, eh, challenging to do with XSL :)
messageBody:
Hi Jan,

On 11/1/06, Jan Cumps <j_cumps@...> wrote:
> >>On 10/31/06, Bo Liu <hitliubo@...> wrote:
> > ... executed successfully, I really cannot imagine how
> the XSL could come
> >up with that information on its own...
>
> That would have been me. It's not possible to capture
> successful asserts.
> But I told Bo Liu that the XML document captures
> System.out and System.error
> info.
> That can be rendered into a report via XSL.

I see. That makes sense, although parsing the relevant stuff from a
big chunk of output might be somewhat, eh, "challenging" to do with
XSL :)

Lasse
